title: Mum of two is caught driving while high on meth but claims she shouldn't lose her licence
text:
A mother-of-two caught driving while under the influence of meth has been allowed back on the roads.

Hayley Rose Glover, 25, was busted with the class A drug in her system as she drove on Caloundra Road at Meridan Plains, in the Sunshine Coast, on July 27.

Glover pleaded guilty on Tuesday to driving driving while a relevant drug was present in her saliva, the Sunshine Coast Daily reported.

Hayley Rose Glover, 25, was busted with meth in her system as she drove on Caloundra Road at Meridan Plains in the Sunshine Coast on July 27 and given a licence ban

Glover, who works as a cleaner seven days a week, was granted a work licence so she can get to her job

The court heard Glover had two children, aged three and six.

When Glover told Magistrate Stephanie Tonkin the age of her children, she responded: 'Oh dear, they're tiny.'

'There is simply no licence available for us to transfer our children or do any personal errands.'

Glover was fined $450 and disqualified from driving for six weeks.

But she was granted a work licence so she could get to her job as a cleaner.
